question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:

All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.body:
(a) This resolves to YES if Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Otherwise, it resolves to NO.

(b) This resolves to YES if Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th, confirmed by Kamala herself. It resolves to NO if she announces anyone else as her running mate.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20 nor (b) Kamala Harris picks either Kelly or Shapiro as her VP?
not_P.body:
(a) This resolves to YES if Biden does not drop out and is otherwise able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Otherwise, it resolves to NO.

(b) This resolves to YES if Kamala Harris does not announce her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th, confirmed by Kamala herself. It resolves to NO if she announces anyone else as her running mate.

question.title: Will Ireland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ireland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ireland does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ireland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will both Ireland and Cyprus qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Cyprus participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Ireland or Cyprus does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Ireland nor Cyprus qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occur: (a) Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, nor (b) Cyprus participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Ireland or Cyprus qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Glenn Youngkin be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

not_P.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet not cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
not_P.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post does not cover the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers Joe Biden's dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) another Democratic party presidential debate nor (b) Joe Biden's dropout covered by reliable media at least 6 hours in advance?
not_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is no debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) Question resolves YES if no big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers Joe Biden's dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will the Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).  If no such agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**.

If such an agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

not_P.body:

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by less than 3% when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not testify at the hush money trial?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden vs a generic Democrat, (b) Trump testifies at the hush money trial?
question.body:
(a) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One poll includes Joe Biden and the other a generic Democrat. This resolves YES if Trump's votes in poll 1 exceed poll 2 by 3% or more, based on the formula: (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). Otherwise, NO.

(b) This resolves YES if credible sources report Trump has testified, in person or remotely, at the trial concerning "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following not occur: (a) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden vs a generic Democrat, (b) Trump does not testify at the hush money trial?
not_P.body:

This resolves YES if Trump's votes in poll 1 do not exceed poll 2 by 3% or more, based on the formula: (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). Otherwise, NO.

(b) This resolves YES if credible sources report Trump has not testified, in person or remotely, at the trial concerning "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

not_P.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI not increase by more than 0.1% in July?

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

not_P.title: Will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and do not cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker does not ask Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July 2024 (b) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

(b) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July 2024 nor (b) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 does not increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

(b) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. If this occurs, this condition is satisfied.

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This condition is satisfied if the removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, this condition is not satisfied.

Both conditions (a) and (b) must be satisfied for the overall question to be answered affirmatively.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20, 2024, nor (b) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. If this occurs, this condition is not satisfied.

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This condition is not satisfied if the removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is removed or blocked from any ballot, this condition is satisfied.

Neither condition (a) nor (b) must be satisfied for the overall question to be answered negatively.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

not_P.title: Will Russia not have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as not under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President AND will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle.

2. On June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any category indicating Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other category indicating Russian control.

If either of these conditions is not met, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President OR will Russia not have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following conditions is met:

1. Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will seek or will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be ambiguous or inconclusive, leaving room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle.

2. On June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) does not show the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any category indicating Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other category indicating Russian control.

If both of these conditions are met, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024.  This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect.

It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government

not_P.title: Will Scotland not hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is no referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024.  This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect.

It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government.

question.title: Will Georgia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Georgia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Georgia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Estonia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Estonia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Estonia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Estonia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Estonia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Estonia qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will both Georgia and Estonia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Estonia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will either Georgia or Estonia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if at least one of the following occurs: (a) Georgia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Estonia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

not_P.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet not cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
not_P.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post does not cover the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If he is selected, it will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance? (b) Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) The first part resolves YES if a major and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers President Joe Biden's dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. This part resolves as N/A if Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

(b) The second part resolves YES if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet not cover the story at least 6 hours in advance? (b) Will Donald Trump Jr. not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
(a) The first part resolves YES if no major and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers President Joe Biden's dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. This part resolves as N/A if Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

(b) The second part resolves YES if Donald Trump Jr. is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is not selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who does not receive the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will Inflection publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: For Inflection, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

not_P.title: Will Inflection not publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
not_P.body: For Inflection, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they do not publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

not_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT not be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
not_P.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If available in certain EU countries, or available to (for example) minors, this will still resolve negatively, assuming at least >50% of the population cannot use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves negatively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially different (not entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

not_P.body:
(a) For Inflection, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they do not publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

not_P.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the underdog on Friday?
not_P.body:

This market will resolve to “No” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

2. Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date.

The question will resolve as **No** if either or both of these conditions are not met.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election nor (b) 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following conditions are met:

1. Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

2. Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date.

The question will resolve as **No** if either or both of these conditions are met.

question.title: Will Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both the winner of the men's and winner's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin roots, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

not_P.title: Will Kalenjin athletes not win both the men's and women's marathon races at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either the winner of the men's or the winner's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris does not have Kalenjin roots, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: Will a swimmer win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: The question resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.

not_P.title: Will a swimmer not win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body: The question resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals does not compete in the swimming events.

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races, and (b) a swimmer wins the most gold medals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) The winner of both the men's and women's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin roots, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). (2) The athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following NOT occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races, or (b) a swimmer wins the most gold medals?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met: (1) Either the winner of the men's or women's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris does not have Kalenjin roots, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). (2) The athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals does not compete in the swimming events.

question.title: Will Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Malta not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Serbia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Serbia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For all other countries, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Serbia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Serbia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For all other countries, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will both Malta and Serbia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Malta participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Serbia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Malta nor Serbia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occur: (a) Malta participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, nor (b) Serbia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both do qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than th..."The Wolverine" combined?
question.body:
Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25850/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question resolves as Yes if the domestic box office opening for the Deadpool & Wolverine reported by Boxofficemojo on the movie's page is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for Deadpool (2016) and The Wolverine (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) receive a CinemaScore of B or above?
question.body:
This market resolves YES if "Trap" (2024) receives a B CinemaScore or higher, and it resolves NO if it receives a B- or lower. If for some reason a CinemaScore is not reported, this resolves N/A.

Context: 

"Trap" is the next film directed by the legendary M. Night Shyamalan (with a great trailer).

Here are the CinemaScores for some of his recent films:

"Split" - B+

"Glass" - B

"Old" - C+

"Knock at the Cabin" - C

You can search the CinemaScore website for more examples.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

question.title: [Short Fuse] Will the proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
question.body: The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: [Short Fuse] Will the proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) not advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package AND the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
not_P.body: The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) does not release a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting AND the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Will the linked market get at least 377 traders by end of July 15? (b) Will ISS advise Tesla shareholders to vote against either Elon Musk's $57 billion package or Kimbal Musk's re-election?
question.body: (a) The market embedded in the link (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) must have 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time) for this part to resolve YES. (b) Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) must release a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote against either Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting or the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors for this part to resolve YES. The combined question resolves YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve YES.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Will the linked market get at least 377 traders by end of July 15? (b) Will ISS advise Tesla shareholders to vote against either Elon Musk's $57 billion package or Kimbal Musk's re-election?
not_P.body: (a) The market embedded in the link (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) must not have 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time) for this part to resolve YES. (b) Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) must not release a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote against either Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting or the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors for this part to resolve YES. The combined question resolves YES only if neither (a) nor (b) resolve YES.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

not_P.title: Will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and do not cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland not to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not die before Saturday?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if there is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, and (b) Joe Biden dies before July 26th, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, nor (b) Joe Biden dies before July 26th, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) does not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) Resolves YES if there is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title:
Will the  CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS)

question.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

question.body:

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires only one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will at least 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater.

not_P.title: Will fewer than 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is less than 24.

question.title: Will France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if France place in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medal

not_P.title: Will France not place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve positively if France does not place in the top 5 (ties resolve negatively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medal

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) At least 24 world records are broken and (b) France places in the Top 5?
question.body:
(a) At least 24 world records are broken during the 2024 Paris Olympics, resolving as **Yes** if the count is 24 or greater.

(b) France places in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics, resolving positively if France is in the top 5 (ties included) based on the medal count calculated by:
1. Number of Gold Medals
2. Number of Silver Medals (if Gold is tied)
3. Number of Bronze Medals (if Silver is tied).

The question resolves ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following NOT occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) Fewer than 24 world records are broken or (b) France does not place in the Top 5?
not_P.body:
(a) Fewer than 24 world records are broken during the 2024 Paris Olympics, resolving as **Yes** if the count is less than 24.

(b) France does not place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics, resolving positively if France is not in the top 5 (ties included) based on the medal count calculated by:
1. Number of Gold Medals
2. Number of Silver Medals (if Gold is tied)
3. Number of Bronze Medals (if Silver is tied).

The question resolves ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

question.body: Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals. Resolves no if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

not_P.body: Resolves Yes if Team USA does not win both gold medals. Resolves no if both the men's and women's teams win gold.

question.title: Will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true:

- OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

not_P.title: Will OpenAI not publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, at least one of the following is true:

- OpenAI does not publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a lack of new commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus does not verify that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of dissatisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be less rigorous than "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
question.body:
Resolves **Yes** if one of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024:

 - Donald Trump
 - Donald Trump Jr.
 - Eric Trump
 - Ivanka Trump
 - Tiffany Trump
 - Melania Trump
 - Barron Trump

 - Eric Trump
 - Ivanka Trump
 - Tiffany Trump
 - Melania Trump
 - Barron Trump

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points on July 15, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, a value of 2.4 means Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden.

(b) One of the following individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, nor (b) a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if neither of the following conditions are met:

(a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points on July 15, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, a value of 2.4 means Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden.

(b) None of the following individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump.

question.title: Will Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) close sub $100 per share by 7/31?

question.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

not_P.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI not increase by more than 0.1% in July?
not_P.body:

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) does not show the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:
