question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The lack of removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

question.title: Will both Elon Musk appear at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024 and Donald Trump be removed from any U.S. state primary ballot for a federal office under the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Elon Musk becomes a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, taking place on July 25-27, 2024; (2) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will either Elon Musk not appear at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024 or Donald Trump not be removed from any U.S. state primary ballot for a federal office under the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if at least one of the following conditions is not met: (1) Elon Musk does not become a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, taking place on July 25-27, 2024; (2) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. If both conditions are met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

not_P.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain less than 3% among Manifold respondents?
not_P.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by less than 3% when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will a group of fewer than 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators not pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
not_P.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators do not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by not signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group not speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless fewer than 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving YES.

If these criteria are met before July 20th, this market resolves YES.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, and (2) A group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
(1) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat: 
There are two Manifold polls posted, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks them to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. This will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

(2) A group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th: 
Politico reports multiple drafts of letters among House Democrats, with at least one calling on Biden to end his campaign. This resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In ambiguous cases, this market will err towards resolving NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following occur: (1) Trump does not gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, or (2) A group of fewer than 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators do not pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
not_P.body:
(1) Trump does not gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat: 
There are two Manifold polls posted, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks them to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. This will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 does not exceed that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

(2) A group of fewer than 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators do not pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th: 
Politico reports multiple drafts of letters among House Democrats, with at least one calling on Biden to end his campaign. This resolves YES if a group of fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators do not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. If these criteria are met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

It will certainly play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend

not_P.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine not have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [not ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
not_P.body:
Analysts are not projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is not projected to earn more than $284.5 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mean it does not mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is not expected to debut with more than $160 million to $170 million, making it not the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie not top these marks? It will probably not be close...

It will certainly not play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses $284.5M or less globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) does not report it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is <=$284.5M internationally... this weekend.

question.title: Will Disney announce a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdom at D23 2024 AND will Deadpool & Wolverine have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie?
question.body:
This question will resolve YES if BOTH of the following occur:
(a) Disney announces a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. The announcement must be more than just discussing ideas, and must specifically be for the Magic Kingdom park, not any other park in Florida or elsewhere. Betting closes on August 8, the day before the convention. This part will be resolved after the convention.
(b) The "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie grosses more than $284.5 million globally in its opening weekend according to reports, AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) confirms it as the record for an R-rated movie release. The movie is expected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend, which would make it the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. The current record is held by the original Deadpool at $284.5 million globally.

not_P.title: Will Disney not announce a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdom at D23 2024 OR will Deadpool & Wolverine not have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve YES if EITHER of the following occurs:
(a) Disney does not announce a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. The announcement must be more than just discussing ideas, and must specifically be for the Magic Kingdom park, not any other park in Florida or elsewhere. Betting closes on August 8, the day before the convention. This part will be resolved after the convention.
(b) The "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie grosses $284.5 million or less globally in its opening weekend according to reports, OR the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) does not confirm it as the record for an R-rated movie release. The movie is expected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend, which would make it the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. The current record is held by the original Deadpool at $284.5 million globally.

question.title: Will Mike Pence be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Mike Pence not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Mike Pence is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20, and (b) Mike Pence is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time.
(b) Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Biden does not drop out before July 20, or (b) Mike Pence is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
(a) Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time.
(b) Mike Pence is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
(a) The Greens–EFA political group must hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This resolves as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats, and as **No** for all other outcomes. In case of a tie between groups, this resolves as **Yes**. Resolution is based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

(b) OpenAI's ChatGPT must be generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024. This resolves as **YES** if ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on that date, meaning the default state for EU residents is access without a VPN, possibly requiring payment. Availability issues in some EU countries or to certain demographics (e.g., minors) do not affect this, as long as >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface and resolves positively if the name or website changes, as long as the service remains substantially the same.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections nor (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
not_P.body:

(b) OpenAI's ChatGPT must not be generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024. This resolves as **YES** if ChatGPT is not generally available in the EU on that date, meaning the default state for EU residents is access with a VPN or no access at all. Availability issues in some EU countries or to certain demographics (e.g., minors) do affect this, as long as <=50% of the population cannot use it.

question.title: Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%? ("Certified Fresh")
question.body:
"Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 75% or higher, one week after release (July 26th). 

Details 

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

For example, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. This is the equivalent score I will use.

"Certified Fresh" is just used for illustrative purposes (AFAIK, it requires >=75% Tomatometer, but there might be other restrictions—the market resolves solely based on the displayed score).

"Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), starring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Tucker Carlson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) the Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means that Tucker Carlson must be the candidate chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. A person representing the Republican Party wins the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson). Credible sources must report this victory, and in case of disagreement among popular sources, an Ohio State source or statement will be used to confirm the result. If no special election is held before January 1, 2025, this condition cannot be satisfied and the question is annulled.

If both conditions are satisfied, the answer is **Yes**. If either or both are not satisfied, the answer is **No**.

This means that Tucker Carlson must not be the candidate chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. A person representing the Republican Party does not win the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson). Credible sources must not report this victory, and in case of disagreement among popular sources, an Ohio State source or statement will be used to confirm the result. If no special election is held before January 1, 2025, this condition cannot be satisfied and the question is annulled.

If at least one condition is not satisfied, the answer is **Yes**. If both conditions are satisfied, the answer is **No**.

This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

not_P.title: Will Kamala Harris not be the Democratic VP?
not_P.body: If Kamala Harris is not nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: 
(a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.
(b) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

not_P.title: Will either of the following not occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or (b) Kamala Harris not be the Democratic VP?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if either of the following conditions are not met: 
(a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is not greater than 2 or is greater than 4 in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.
(b) Kamala Harris is not nominated as the Democratic VP. If Kamala Harris is not nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If she is nominated as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

not_P.title: Will Biden not remain President through end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he remains President through the end of July 2024. 

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a NO resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

Multiple such letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will an athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

not_P.title: Will an athlete not win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if no athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥21 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No". 

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

not_P.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win <21 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win fewer than 21 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No". 

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won fewer than 21 gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) an athlete wins more than one medal for tennis, and (b) Individual Neutral Athletes win 21 or more gold medals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (b) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution for condition (b) will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, condition (b) will be considered met immediately.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) an athlete wins more than one medal for tennis, nor (b) Individual Neutral Athletes win 21 or more gold medals?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if neither of the following conditions are met: (a) Any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics, nor (b) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution for condition (b) will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, condition (b) will be considered met immediately.

question.title: Will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Nikki Haley not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If Nikki Haley is selected, this question will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not die before Saturday?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if there is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (2) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. If both conditions are met, the question resolves as **Yes**; otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election nor (b) Joe Biden die before Saturday?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following conditions are met: (1) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (2) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. If neither condition is met, the question resolves as **Yes**; otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will a swimmer win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: The question resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.

not_P.title: Will no swimmer win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body: The question resolves as **Yes** if no athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.

question.title: At the 2024 Olympics, will at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

not_P.title: At the 2024 Olympics, will fewer than 5 countries win their debut gold medal?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if fewer than 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: Will a swimmer win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics and will at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal at the 2024 Olympics?

(b) 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to credible sources.

not_P.title: Will a swimmer not win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics or will fewer than 5 countries win their debut gold medal at the 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if at least one of the following occurs: (a) The athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals does not compete in the swimming events. (b) Fewer than 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to credible sources.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
not_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if no public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires only one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early (b) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
(a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early: This resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

(b) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This resolves as YES if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early (b) Democrats do not have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats do not sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early: This resolves YES if no public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. If at least one such letter is signed by 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to NO. If these criteria are met by market close, this market resolves NO.

(b) Democrats do not have a brokered convention in 2024: This resolves as YES if the Democratic Party does not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) receive a CinemaScore of B or above?
question.body:
This market resolves YES if "Trap" (2024) receives a B CinemaScore or higher, and it resolves NO if it receives a B- or lower. If for some reason a CinemaScore is not reported, this resolves N/A.

Context: 

"Trap" is the next film directed by the legendary M. Night Shyamalan (with a great trailer).

Here are the CinemaScores for some of his recent films:

"Split" - B+

"Glass" - B

"Old" - C+

"Knock at the Cabin" - C

You can search the CinemaScore website for more examples.

question.title: At the 2024 Olympics, will at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal?

not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if fewer than 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥15 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No".

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 15 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

not_P.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win <15 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win fewer than 15 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No".

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won fewer than 15 gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the Paris 2024 Olympics: (a) At least 5 countries win their debut gold medal and (b) Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥15 gold medals?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met during the Paris 2024 Olympic Games:

1. At least 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal, according to credible sources.
2. Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources. If Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 15 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, this part resolves immediately to "Yes".

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following not occur at the Paris 2024 Olympics: (a) At least 5 countries win their debut gold medal or (b) Individual Neutral Athletes win <15 gold medals?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is not met during the Paris 2024 Olympic Games:

1. At least 5 countries do not win their first-ever Olympic gold medal, according to credible sources.
2. Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win fewer than 15 gold medals. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources. If Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won fewer than 15 gold medals prior to the end of the Games, this part resolves immediately to "Yes".

question.title: Will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Will the ID political group not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **No**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Prime Minister of France will belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024; (b) The ID political group will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources. (b) The ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, according to official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. It will resolve as No if either or both of these conditions are not met. If two political groups are tied for seats, condition (b) will still resolve as Yes.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) The Prime Minister of France will belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024; (b) The ID political group will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if neither of the following conditions are met: (a) The party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources. (b) The ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, according to official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. It will resolve as No if either or both of these conditions are met.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election nor (b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **Yes**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be ambiguous or inconclusive: it should leave room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. (2) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

not_P.title: Will Ted Cruz not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election OR will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?

This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. (2) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

(b) Joe Biden is officially the president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is neither dropping out nor resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden does not announce either that he is no longer running for re-election or that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is not sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves YES on August 1st.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

not_P.title: Will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and do not cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to not invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, and will the ICC issue arrest warrants for any listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following occur:

(a) Before August 2024 (Eastern time), the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President. The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Note that Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count, nor does Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment. Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

(b) Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a warrant of arrest for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as NO otherwise.
   - Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
   - Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
   - Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

not_P.title: Will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, or will the ICC not issue arrest warrants for any listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as YES if either of the following does not occur:

(a) Before August 2024 (Eastern time), the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President. The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Note that Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count, nor does Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment. Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

(b) Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) does not issue a warrant of arrest for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as YES otherwise.
   - Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
   - Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
   - Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

question.body:

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination.

(b) Will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This resolves as Yes if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the election.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following not occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, or (b) Chris Christie is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be ambiguous or inconclusive, leaving room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination.

(b) Will Chris Christie not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This resolves as Yes if Chris Christie is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is determined by who is not selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who does not receive the Republican nomination on the day of the election.

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

not_P.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" not be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is not higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

question.title: Will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Nikki Haley not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. At least one other candidate will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

not_P.title: Will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker does not ask Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
(a) Nikki Haley will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if she is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) Biden will be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following not occur: (a) Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or (b) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) Nikki Haley will not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if she is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) Biden will not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not announce that he is either dropping out or resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden does not announce either that he is no longer running for re-election or that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements must not occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. An announcement of his intention to do so will not be sufficient to resolve this market as YES.

Otherwise, this market resolves YES on August 1st.

question.title: Will Iceland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If not, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Iceland not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Iceland does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If so, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Ireland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ireland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Ireland not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ireland does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ireland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will both Iceland and Ireland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Iceland and Ireland participate in their respective Semi-finals and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will either Iceland or Ireland not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either Iceland or Ireland do not participate in their respective Semi-finals or are not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If both qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.
